title: Pinnacles National Park: Animals
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Animals               Animals        White Belted Ringtail Dragonfly Photo by Paul G Johnson   Â    Although Pinnacles National Park is not home to such charismatic megafauna as bison, bears, or blue whales, it supports healthy populations of many kinds of smaller animals such as bobcats, bats, and bees. There are 149 species of birds, 49 mammals, 22 reptiles, 8 amphibians, 71 butterflies, 41 dragonflies and damselflies, more than 400 bees, and many thousands of other invertebrates. To read more about animals at Pinnacles click here. Insects Amphibians Birds Fish Mammals Reptiles Sensitive Species
